page.title: 12CATCHING SPOOTS
page.content: {In Orkney we call Razor fish Spoots. They live in{sandy beaches}about an inch under the sand.You know where to find them because when they move, a little fountain of water gushes up. Here the sand is too hard to pick them out with your hands.Spoots don't go down the sand they move across.The best way to catch a{Spoot}is to find the hole then get a bread knife and slice the sand a few centimetres away from the hole until you hear a clunk.Next slide your hand and grab the spoot. This year we had a competition and the best catch was 202 in one night.You can eat them raw but most people eat them boiled.
